chargeHist.descr: Harboring/Aiding a Felon (A/B/C/D or unclassified felony/life)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter of support for defendant.
Plea date scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defense counsel advises Court they are in resolution posture.
Discussion with the parties; co-defendant Case# 22CF00305 scheduled for sentencing on December 9, 2022.

Court orders this case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Reserve Branch 25.

Clerk:  jms

Attorney Nicholas M Weege in court with Melissa P Calvert.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Judge Franke held the trial for co-defendant Chambliss and has agreed to take all the co-defendant cases.  All parties are in agreement.  Court orders case adjourned for a scheduling conference in Judge Franke.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Danelle Faith Eaton in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael a Verrilli in court for Danelle Faith Eaton.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defense is requesting bail be modified to $2,500.00.  State objects to the modification, request bail remain as is.  Court is not inclined to modify the bail and DENIES defense request.

Court orders case adjourned for Scheduling Conference.

NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL, received and filed.

Attorney Michael a Verrilli in court, defendant Danelle Faith Eaton not in court, in custody.  Paul Tiffin for Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties are in a resoluation posture and request an adjournment.  Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael a Verrilli in court, defendant Danelle Faith Eaton not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Bail Bond Hearing. Defendant not produced. Arguments heard as to bail. Court adjusts bail down to $ 20,000.00. Court orders previous conditions to remain in full force and effect. Case remains calendared as previously set. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04B (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.
Notice Of Motion And Motion To Modify Bail - received
Court id DOWN on 07/01/2022. Matter is rescheduled. Parties notified.  Bail/Bond Review scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael a Verrilli in court, defendant Danelle Faith Eaton not in court, in custody.  Defendant's Appearance Waived.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Status Conference.  Defense close to resolution and requested adjournment.  Pro se for a reduction in bail was filed by Defense.  Defense requested Bail/Bond Review date. Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin via video means.
Case in court for status conference. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Discussions placed on the record. Court informs all parties that there will not be any more adjourned statuses. Court sets matter before Branch 15 for adjourned hearing.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction or signature/PR bond.  (Danelle F. Eaton - #2022000686, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Danelle Faith Eaton in court with attorney Michael a Verrilli.  Defendant Danelle Faith Eaton in custody. 
Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared on the behalf of Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for arraignment. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Filed, original information; copy served on defendant. Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty. Defense in receipt of partial discovery and requests a brief adjournment. Case remains calendared before br. 15.  Status conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Danelle Faith Eaton in court by video with Attorney Michael A Verrilli who appears in person.  Defendant Danelle Faith Eaton in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 15, Judge J.D. Watts. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. State requests an arraignment. Case is adjourned to Br. 15.  Arraignment scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Danelle Faith Eaton in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Danelle Faith Eaton in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Danelle Faith Eaton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
